intro: Collabium aneityumense, commonly known as the Aneityum collabium, is a flowering plant native to the island of Aneityum in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
